thread.title: H.S. boys cross-country: Around the course - Boys Cross-Country

author: The Record
title: H.S. boys cross-country: Around the course - Boys Cross-Country
text:
Around the course 
* With the boys' two wins Wednesday against Cresskill and Bergen Arts & Science and the girls' win over Bergen Arts & Science, Jay Mahoney's Bogota teams reached the 300-win mark in dual-meet victories. Mahoney has won 169 boys duals and 131 girls editions (since taking over in 1986 from the late Joe Feigel) and has 590 wins in boys basketball. His cross-country teams have won two girls Group 1 state titles, 14 combined Bergen division titles, eight sectionals and 17 league titles in addition to the dual-meet wins.
* While the Dalys (Will and Colin) will miss the Shore Coaches Invitational, their River Dell teammates will compete in the Boys Varsity D race, weather permitting, one of about 20 North Jersey schools in the state's largest invitational meet at the state meet course Saturday in Holmdel.
* North Jersey schools will compete in 12 of the 13 varsity races, with no one entered in the A-2 race at 2:35 p.m. The top local entrants include the Ridgewood girls team, making its major meet debut in the A race at 3:35; Northern Highlands and Wayne Hills in the girls B race at 3:15, Old Tappan, Pascack Valley and Ramapo in girls C at 2:55, Ramsey and River Dell in girls D at 11:35 a.m. and Holy Angels in girls E at 11:35 a.m.
* The highlight of the day at the Shore should be the Boys B race at 1:55 p.m., with Indian Hills, Ridgewood and Wayne Hills locking horns, with Demarest, Old Tappan and Pascack Valley in the Boys C race at 1:35 p.m.
* The other major race on the calendar Saturday is the Brett Taylor Invitational, held for the 23rd time to honor the memory of the former Hackensack cross-country captain who died in 1992. The proceeds help finance scholarships awarded to Bergen County runners who must apply and complete an essay on how being part of a cross-country and track team has helped their development.
â€” Paul Schwartz
